Question: What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe

Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
If you are driving and you want to use a cellphone what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Stop in the flush median to answer calls when it is safe to do so
Answer the call at the next set of traffic signals
Slow down to answer the call when it is safe to do so
Pull over and stop to use the cellphone when it is safe to do so

Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Question: If you can do so safely, you may pass on the left at an intersection if:

Answers.Answer: you have the headlights of your vehicle turned on
the vehicle in front is signalling a left turn
the vehicle in front is signalling a right turn
the vehicle in front is going faster than the speed limit

What does this sign mean?
Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.
Flush medians can be used when:
What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass
